trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The abhorrent overlord's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/Day: confusion, crown of madness, suggestion

trait.name: Insatiable Greed
trait.text: The abhorrent overlord can sense the presence of gold within 1,000 feet of itself. It can determine which location has the greatest amount of gold and can sense the direction to that site. If the gold is being moved, it knows the direction of the movement. It can't locate gold if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between it and the gold.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The abhorrent overlord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The abhorrent overlord makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. The abhorrent overlord regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt if the target is a creature.

action.name: Storm of Crows (Recharge 6)
action.text: The abhorrent overlord conjures a swarm of spectral crows and harpies in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the overlord can see within 120 feet of it. The sphere remains for 1 minute or until the overlord loses concentration (as if concentrating on a spell), and its area is lightly obscured and difficult terrain.

Any creature that moves into the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a 15 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 16 (3d10) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Hold the Line
trait.text: While the hoplite is holding a spear, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from the hoplite when they move within 5 feet of it. When the hoplite hits a creature with an opportunity attack using its spear, the creature takes an extra 4 (1d8) piercing damage, and the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hoplite makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

monster.name: Alseid

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The alseid's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
3/Day: cure wounds, charm person, sleep
1/Day: calm emotions, lesser restoration, plant growth

monster.spells: Cure Wounds,Charm Person,Sleep,Calm Emotions,Lesser Restoration,Plant Growth

trait.name: Hide in Plain Sight
trait.text: The alseid has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while it is in grassland.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The alseid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The alseid makes two radiant touch attacks.

action.name: Radiant Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) radiant damage.

monster.name: Anvilwrought Raptor
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Keen Sight
trait.text: The raptor has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Recorded Mimicry
trait.text: The raptor can mimic any sound, including voices, it has heard in the last 24 hours. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful 12 Wisdom (Insight) check.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The raptor makes two attacks with its beak.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If Aphemia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Aphemia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Aphemia makes two attacks: one with her bite and one with her claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Discordant Song
action.text: Aphemia shrieks a cacophony of magical sounds. Each humanoid within 120 feet of her must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of her until the song ends. A frightened creature takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage at the start of its turn while Aphemia is singing. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Aphemia's Discordant Song for the next 24 hours. Aphemia must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Aphemia is incapacitated or dies.

action.name: Grave Calling Song
action.text: Aphemia intones a low, growling magical melody. Every undead within 300 feet of her must succeed on a 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall under her control until the song ends. Aphemia must take a bonus action on her subsequent turns to continue singing, and she can mentally command the undead under her control as part of the same bonus action. She can stop singing at any time. The song ends if Aphemia is incapacitated or dies.

monster.name: Arasta
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Armor of Spiders (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: If Arasta is reduced to 0 hit points, she doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, she regains 200 hit points. In addition, Arasta's children immediately swarm over her body to protect her, granting her 100 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Arasta fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Arasta has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: Arasta can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
trait.text: Arasta ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Arasta makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage, and the target must make a 21 Constitution saving throw, taking 32 (5d12) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Web of Hair (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Arasta unleashes her hair in the form of webbing that fills a 30-foot cube next to her. The web is difficult terrain, its area is lightly obscured, and it lasts for 1 minute. Any creature that moves into the web or that starts its turn there must make a 21 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is restrained while in the web. A creature can use an action to make a 21 Strength check. On a success, it can free itself or a creature within 5 feet of it that is restrained by the web. This webbing is immune to all damage except magical fire. A 5-foot cube of the web is destroyed if it takes at least 20 fire damage from a spell or other magical source on a single turn.

legendary.name: Claws
legendary.text: Arasta makes one attack with her claws.

legendary.name: Swarm (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Arasta causes two swarm of spiders to appear in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of her.

legendary.name: Toxic Web (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Each creature restrained by Arasta's Web of Hair takes 18 (4d8) poison damage.

monster.name: Archon of Falling Stars

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The archon's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The archon can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: command, guiding bolt, spare the dying
1/Day: crusader's mantle, spirit guardians

monster.spells: Command,Guiding Bolt,Spare the Dying,Crusader's Mantle,Spirit Guardians

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The archon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Mount
trait.text: If the archon isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto the creature serving as its mount, provided the archon and its mount are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the archon appears astride the mount, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, the archon can't be surprised, and both it and its mount have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. If the archon is reduced to 0 hit points while riding its mount, the mount is reduced to 0 hit points as well.

trait.name: Radiant Rebirth (Recharges after a Long Rest)
trait.text: If the archon is reduced to 0 hit points, it regains 30 hit points and springs back to its feet with a burst of radiance. Each creature of the archon's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a 16 Constitution saving throw, or the creature takes 13 (3d8) radiant damage and is blinded until the start of the archon's turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The archon makes two attacks with its radiant spear.

action.name: Radiant Spear
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The archon makes a radiant spear attack or casts guiding bolt.

legendary.name: Coordinated Assault (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The archon makes a radiant spear attack, and then its mount can use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack.

legendary.name: Return to Nyx (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The archon causes a corpse it can see within 30 feet of it to burst into a shower of radiant stars leaving no trace of it behind. Everything it is wearing or carrying remains. Each creature within 10 feet of the corpse when it bursts must succeed on a 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (4d10) radiant damage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The ashen rider's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 18). The rider can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: command, compelled duel
1/Day: banishment, blade barrier

trait.name: Aura of Silence
trait.text: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the ashen rider, the rider can force that creature to make a 18 Wisdom saving throw if the rider can see it. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature can't speak and is deafened until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Mount
trait.text: If the ashen rider isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto the creature serving as its mount, provided the ashen rider and its mount are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the ashen rider appears astride the mount along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying.

While mounted and not incapacitated, the ashen rider can't be surprised, and both it and its mount have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. If the ashen rider is reduced to 0 hit points while riding its mount, the mount is reduced to 0 hit points as well.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The ashen rider makes three attacks with its ashen blade or two attacks with its bolt of ash.

action.name: Ashen Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 13 (2d12) radiant damage.

action.name: Bolt of Ash
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 22 (4d10) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the ashen rider's next turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The ashen rider makes an attack using its ashen blade or bolt of ash.

legendary.name: Coordinated Assault (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The ashen rider makes an attack using its ashen blade or bolt of ash, and then its mount can use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack.

legendary.name: Reduce to Ash (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: The ashen rider targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw, or it takes 27 (5d10) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If the target's hit point maximum is reduced to 0, its body and everything it is wearing and carrying, except for magic items, are reduced to ash. A creature reduced to ash can't be revived by any means short of a wish spell.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
trait.text: The harpy has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
trait.text: The harpy has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The harpy makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If Antigonos moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
trait.text: Antigonos can perfectly recall any path he has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
trait.text: At the start of his turn, Antigonos can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

trait.name: Decrepit State
trait.text: Antigonos has disadvantage on his attack rolls.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Amphora
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If there is not already a creature inside the amphora, the target is restrained inside. As an action, the restrained creature can make a 14 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, escaping from the amphora on a success. The effect also ends if the amphora is destroyed. The amphora has AC 8, 20 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

monster.name: Bronze Sable
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the sable remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The sable has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sable's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
trait.text: If the sable surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sable makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

monster.name: Burnished Hart
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the hart moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with an antlers attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Heated Body
trait.text: A creature that touches the hart or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The hart has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hart makes two attacks: one with its antlers and one with its hooves.

action.name: Antlers
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

monster.name: Colossus of Akros
monster.immune: fire,poison,psychic,bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: understands Common and Celestial but can't speak

trait.name: Crumbling Destruction
trait.text: When the colossus drops to 0 hit points, it crumbles and is destroyed. Any creature on the ground within 30 feet of the crumbling statue must make a 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) bludgeoning damage and 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
trait.text: Whenever the colossus is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: The colossus's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The colossus of Akros makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., or range 200/600 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) piercing damage, or 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the colossus makes a ranged attack with this spear, the spear magically returns to its hand after the attack.

action.name: Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (6d8 + 9) slashing damage.

action.name: Flames of Akros (Recharge 6)
action.text: Magical flames issue from the colossus toward up to three creatures the colossus can see within 90 feet of it. Each target must make a 24 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a target also magically catches fire for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the burning target repeats the saving throw. It takes 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, and the effect ends on a successful one.

trait.name: Aura of Erebos
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the giant must succeed on a 18 Constitution saving throw, or it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the giant's Aura of Erebos for 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The giant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Noxious Gust (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The giant exhales a mighty gust that creates a blast of deadly mist in a 60-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

trait.name: Insatiable Greed
trait.text: The eater of hope can sense the presence of gold within 1,000 feet of itself. It can determine which location has the greatest amount of gold and can sense the direction to that site. If the gold is being moved, it knows the direction of the movement. It can't locate gold if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between it and the gold.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The eater of hope has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eater of hope makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Breath of Hopelessness (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The eater of hope exhales a miasma of Underworld winds in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and is cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this way, the target takes an extra 6 (1d12) necrotic damage whenever the eater of hope hits it with an attack. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't cursed.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Running Leap
trait.text: With a 10-foot running start, the lion can long jump up to 25 feet.

trait.name: Spell Turning
trait.text: The lion has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the lion (not an area). If the lion's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the lion and instead targets the caster.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lion makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Claw
legendary.text: The lion makes one claw attack.

legendary.name: Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The lion emits a magical roar. Each creature within 60 feet of the lion that can hear the roar must succeed on a 12 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the lion until the end of the lion's next turn.

monster.name: Flitterstep Eidolon
monster.resist: necrotic,bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Blurred Form
trait.text: Attack rolls against the eidolon are made with disadvantage unless the eidolon is incapacitated.

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the eidolon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the eidolon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eidolon makes two melee attacks. Immediately before or after one of its attacks, it can use Flitterstep if it is available.

action.name: Flickering Dagger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Flitterstep (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The eidolon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it. If it makes an attack immediately after teleporting, it has advantage on the attack roll.

monster.name: Ghostblade Eidolon
monster.resist: necrotic,bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Blurred Form
trait.text: Attack rolls against the eidolon are made with disadvantage unless the eidolon is incapacitated.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The eidolon makes two ghostblade attacks.

action.name: Ghostblade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage.

monster.name: Gold-Forged Sentinel
monster.languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the sentinel moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Spell Turning
trait.text: The sentinel has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the sentinel (not an area). If the sentinel's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the sentinel and instead targets the caster.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The sentinel makes two ram attacks.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The sentinel exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The hippocamp can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the hippocamp moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Reactive
trait.text: The giant can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

trait.name: Vigilant
trait.text: The giant can't be surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The giant makes four longsword attacks or two rock attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 21 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reaction.name: Deflect Attack
reaction.text: The giant adds 5 to its AC against one weapon attack that would hit it. To do so, the giant must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: Hythonia's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 18). She can innately cast animate objects once per day requiring no material components.
1: animate objects

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Hythonia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
trait.text: When a creature that can see Hythonia's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of her, Hythonia can force it to make a 18 Constitution saving throw if she isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, on a failed save the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Hythonia until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Hythonia in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If Hythonia sees herself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of her and in an area of bright light, she is affected by her own gaze.

trait.name: Shed Skin (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: If Hythonia is reduced to 0 hit points, she doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, she sheds her skin, regains 199 hit points, and moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Hythonia makes three attacks: one with her claws, one to constrict, and one with her snaky hair.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and Hythonia can't constrict another target.

action.name: Snaky Hair
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (4d12 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and Hythonia can pull the target up to 5 feet closer to her if it is a Large or smaller creature.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: Hythonia moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Snaky Hair
legendary.text: Hythonia makes one attack with her snaky hair.

legendary.name: Petrified Earth (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Hythonia causes stone spikes to erupt from the ground in a 30-foot radius centered on her. The area becomes difficult terrain until the start of her next turn. Any creature, other than Hythonia, takes 9 (2d8) piercing damage for every 5 feet it moves on those spikes.

trait.name: Acidic Blood
trait.text: When the hydra takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of the hydra takes 9 (2d8) acid damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
trait.text: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Whenever the hydra takes 35 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
trait.text: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
trait.text: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The lampad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (+6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: chill touch (see "Actions" below), gentle repose

trait.name: Corpse Stride
trait.text: Once on its turn, the lampad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one creature's corpse within its reach and emerge from a second creature's corpse within 60 feet of the first corpse, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second corpse. Both corpses must be Medium or bigger.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The lampad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The lampad attacks twice with its necrotic touch or chill touch.

action.name: Necrotic Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) necrotic damage.

action.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the lampad's next turn. If the target is undead, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the lampad until the end of the lampad's next turn.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The leonin's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/Day: banishment, detect evil and good

trait.name: Evasion
trait.text: If the leonin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
trait.text: While the leonin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The leonin makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

action.name: Dart
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

monster.name: Medusa
monster.trait: Petrifying Gaze When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a 14 Constitution saving throw if the medusa isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save., If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa is, due to its curse, affected by its own gaze.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The medusa makes either three melee attacks—one with its snake hair, one to constrict, and one with its shortsword—or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Snake Hair
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 11). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the medusa can't constrict another target.

monster.name: Meletian Hoplite

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The hoplite is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:
Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost (see "Actions" below)
1st Level (4 slots): color spray, expeditious retreat, sleep
2nd Level (2 slots): blur, cloud of daggers, invisibility

monster.spells: Mage Hand,Minor Illusion,Ray of Frost,Color Spray,Expeditious Retreat,Sleep,Blur,Cloud of Daggers,Invisibility

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hoplite makes three weapon attacks. It can replace one weapon attack with ray of frost.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Ray of Frost (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the hoplite's next turn.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The naiad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: minor illusion
3: phantasmal force
1/Day: fly, hypnotic pattern

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The naiad can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Invisible in Water
trait.text: The naiad is invisible while fully immersed in water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The naiad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The naiad makes two psychic touch attacks.

action.name: Psychic Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) psychic damage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The shepherd's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/Day: confusion, dispel magic, hold person, suggestion

trait.name: Aura of Nightmares
trait.text: Undead creatures within 30 feet of the shepherd gain a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When any other creature that isn't undead or a construct starts its turn within 30 feet of the shepherd, that creature must succeed on a 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The shepherd has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The shepherd makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its staff.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 26 (4d12) psychic damage.

action.name: Herd the Underworld (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The shepherd pulls twisted souls from the Underworld; 1d6 shadow (without Sunlight Weakness) arise in unoccupied spaces within 20 feet of the shepherd. The shadows act right after the shepherd on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear when the shepherd dies.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the ram moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The ram has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
trait.text: The ram has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws against effects that would knock it prone.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The oracle's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: guidance, light, thaumaturgy
3/Day: bless, guiding bolt, healing word, hold person
1/Day: augury, scrying

trait.name: Blessings of the Gods
trait.text: While the oracle is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier. In addition, a creature that hits the oracle with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 9 (2d8) force damage.

action.name: Eldritch Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) force damage.

reaction.name: Divine Insight (3/Day)
reaction.text: When the oracle or a creature it can see makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, the oracle can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The oread's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: fire bolt (see "Actions" below)
3: burning hands
1/Day: hellish rebuke (see "Reactions" below), scorching ray

trait.name: Invisible in Fire
trait.text: The oread is invisible while fully immersed in fire.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The oread has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The oread attacks twice with its fiery touch or fire bolt.

action.name: Fiery Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke (2nd-Level Spell; 1/Day)
reaction.text: When the oread is damaged by a creature within 60 feet of the oread that it can see, the creature that damaged the oread must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Gatekeeper's Aura
trait.text: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the phylaskia must make a 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on saving throws and its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the phylaskia to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the phylaskia drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Vigilant
trait.text: The phylaskia can't be surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The phylaskia makes two longsword attacks and uses its Strength Drain once.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

action.name: Strength Drain
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage. Unless the target is immune to necrotic damage, its Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Acidic Blood
trait.text: When Polukranos takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within 5 feet of Polukranos takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
trait.text: Polukranos can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Polukranos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
trait.text: Polukranos has five heads. While it has more than one head, Polukranos has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Whenever Polukranos takes 40 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, Polukranos dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken 40 or more fire damage since its last turn. Polukranos regains 20 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
trait.text: For each head Polukranos has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only to make opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: Polukranos deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Wakeful
trait.text: While Polukranos sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Polukranos makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a 21 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 20 feet away from Polukranos.

legendary.name: Detect
legendary.text: Polukranos makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
legendary.text: Polukranos makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Trampling Charge (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Polukranos moves up to 50 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature Huge or smaller. The first time it enters each creature's space during this move, it can make a stomp attack against that creature.

monster.name: Returned Drifter
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The Returned has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Unreadable Face
trait.text: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Returned Kakomantis
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Fleeting Anger
trait.text: If another creature deals damage to the Returned, the Returned makes attack rolls with advantage until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The Returned has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Unreadable Face
trait.text: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Underworld Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the Returned's next turn. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 17 (2d12 + 2) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Returned Palamnite
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Fleeting Anger
trait.text: If another creature deals damage to the Returned, the Returned makes attack rolls with advantage until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The Returned has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Unreadable Face
trait.text: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Returned makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

monster.name: Returned Sentry
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The Returned has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Returned's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
trait.text: The Returned has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Unreadable Face
trait.text: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

action.name: Sling
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Enthralling Performance
trait.text: If the satyr performs for at least 1 minute, it chooses up to four humanoids within 60 feet of it who watched or listened to the entire performance. Each target must succeed on a 13 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed. While charmed in this way, the target idolizes the satyr and will take part in the satyr's revels. The charmed condition ends for the creature after 1 hour, if it takes any damage, if the satyr attacks the target, or if the target witnesses the satyr attacking or damaging any of the target's allies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sleepless Reveler
trait.text: Magic can't put the satyr to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The satyr makes two ram attacks or two shortbow attacks.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sleepless Reveler
trait.text: Magic can't put the satyr to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The satyr makes three ram attacks or three shortbow attacks.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Hail of Arrows (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
action.text: The satyr fires an arrow that magically transforms into a flurry of missiles in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The hoplite has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hoplite's allies is within 5 feet of the hoplite and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hoplite makes two scimitar attacks or two longbow attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

trait.name: Spell Turning
trait.text: The chimera has advantage on a saving throw against any spell that targets only the chimera (not an area). If the chimera's saving throw is successful and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the chimera and instead targets the caster.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its claws, one with its head, and one with its tail. When its breath weapon is available, it can use the breath in place of its head or its claws.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Head
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The chimera exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 32 (5d12) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Triton Master of Waves

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The triton's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: ray of frost (see "Actions" below)
2: cone of cold
1/Day: fog cloud, gust of wind, wind wall

monster.spells: Ray of Frost,Cone of Cold,Fog Cloud,Gust of Wind,Wind Wall

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The triton can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Summon Water Weird (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: As a bonus action, the triton magically summons 1d4 water weird. The summoned weirds appear in unoccupied spaces in water within 60 feet of the triton. The water weirds act immediately after the triton on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear if the triton dies.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The triton makes two attacks using Wave Touch and casts ray of frost.

action.name: Wave Touch
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d10) cold damage.

action.name: Ray of Frost (Cantrip)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the triton's next turn.

reaction.name: Frigid Shield
reaction.text: When a creature the triton can see targets the triton with an attack, the triton gains 10 temporary hit points. If the attack hits and reduces the temporary hit points to 0, each creature within 5 feet of the triton takes 9 (2d8) cold damage.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The triton's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
1/Day: fog cloud, gust of wind

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The triton can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
trait.text: The triton can take the Disengage or Hide actions as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The triton makes two urchin-spine shortsword attacks.

action.name: Urchin-Spine Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage. If the damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Poisoned Spine
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

monster.name: Tromokratis
monster.immune: fire,bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Tromokratis can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Hearts of the Kraken (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
trait.text: When Tromokratis is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, the damage creates cracks in its carapace, revealing its hearts. Tromokratis has four hearts: two on its chest, one on its back, and one at the base of its tail. A heart has an AC of 22 and 100 hit points. It is immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, and it is immune to all conditions. If it is forced to make a saving throw, treat its ability scores as 10 (+0). If it finishes a short or long rest, the carapace heals, any destroyed hearts regenerate, and the hearts are covered again. Tromokratis dies when all the hearts are destroyed.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Tromokratis fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
trait.text: Tromokratis's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: Tromokratis deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Spell-Resistant Carapace
trait.text: Tromokratis has advantage on saving throws against spells, and any creature that makes a spell attack against Tromokratis has disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Tromokratis makes three attacks: one with its pincer, one with its tail, and one with its tentacle grasp.

action.name: Pincer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape 26). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and Tromokratis can't use this attack on anyone else.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 23 (3d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it is knocked prone.

action.name: Tentacle Grasp
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature. Hit: 20 (3d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 26). If the target doesn't escape by the end of its next turn, Tromokratis throws the target up to 60 feet in a straight line. The target lands prone and takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature grappled by Tromokratis, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Tromokratis, and it takes 42 (12d6) acid damage at the start of each of Tromokratis's turns. If Tromokratis takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, Tromokratis must succeed on a 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of Tromokratis. If Tromokratis dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: Tromokratis moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Tail
legendary.text: Tromokratis makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Tromokratis makes one bite attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the cerberus can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Multiheaded
trait.text: The cerberus can't be surprised, and it has advantage on saving throws against being knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The cerberus has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the cerberus's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cerberus makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The cerberus exhales a 15-foot cone of molten rock. Each creature in the cone must make a 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a creature is also restrained by the hardening rock. A creature can make a 12 Strength (Athletics) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and 10 hit points, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The typhon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The typhon regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The typhon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The typhon makes three attacks: one with its Flurry of Bites, one to constrict, and one with its maw.

action.name: Flurry of Bites
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 35 (8d6 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape 19). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The typhon can have up to two creatures constricted.

action.name: Maw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) piercing damage plus 19 (3d12) acid damage.

monster.name: Underworld Cerberus
monster.languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Aggressive
trait.text: As a bonus action, the cerberus can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Multiheaded
trait.text: The cerberus can't be surprised, and it has advantage on saving throws against being knocked unconscious.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The cerberus has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the cerberus's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The cerberus makes three bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The cerberus exhales a 30-foot cone of molten rock. Each creature in the cone must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a creature is also restrained by the hardening rock. A creature can make a 15 Strength (Athletics) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and 20 hit points, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage.

trait.name: Charge
trait.text: If the bull moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 19 (3d12) piercing damage.

action.name: Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) piercing damage.

trait.name: Pounce
trait.text: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
trait.text: The woe strider's open mouth creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a 60-foot cone. At the start of each of its turns, the woe strider decides which way the cone faces and whether its mouth is open or closed.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The woe strider makes two claw attacks and one bite attack. If both claws hit the same creature, the target is grappled (escape 14).

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is grappled, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage. In addition, each magic item the creature is carrying that isn't an artifact has its magical properties suppressed for 1 minute.
